result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin A Misanin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Defendant shall not have direct or indirect contact with any Walmart stores in Washington County.
Defendant shall participate in all counseling or treatment programs as directed by his suspervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Def in person & by Atty Katherine Romanowich.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson appeared for State. Agreement reached. Counts #1 and #2 amended on State's motion to misdemeanor retail theft per 943.50(1m)(b)(4)(a) Wis. Stats. Def pleads no contest to counts #1 and #2 as amended; def is convicted and sentenced.
